intro: Parnassia fimbriata var. intermedia, commonly known as the Intermediate Parnassia, is a flowering plant native to alpine and subalpine regions of North America. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has a rosette of narrow, fimbriated leaves. It is often found in open meadows and along stream banks at high elevations. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
